data.name: Select you phone number
data.description: #### Task: Create a function number_check for a web form on a telecommunications operator's website. The form allows users to input their favorite number and receive a list of available numbers for selection. #### Function Requirements: The number_check function takes three inputs: * num: A vector of strings representing a list of available phone numbers. * mask: An integer representing the user's favorite number. * tail: A boolean indicating whether the user wants to search for numbers that end with their favorite number (tail = true) or contain their favorite number anywhere (tail = false). > Phone numbers from an operator can come in different formats with various separators, but they always consist of numbers. #### Function Behavior: The function should filter the input vector num and return a new vector containing only those phone numbers that meet the following conditions: * If tail is true, the phone number should end with the string representation of mask. * If tail is false, the phone number should contain the string representation of mask anywhere. * The function should ignore any non-digit characters in the phone numbers. > So, you don't need to change the format of the input data. #### Example: If the user inputs their favorite number as 123 and selects the option to search for numbers that end with 123, the function should return a list of available phone numbers that end with 123 (e.g., +3-124-451-31-23, +3-124-551-23, etc.). If the user selects the option to search for numbers that contain 123 anywhere, the function should return a list of available phone numbers that contain 123 (e.g., 8-918-123-45-61, +1-444-123-45-61, etc.). ```rust number_check(vec!["+7-999-123-45-67","+7-999-123-45-68","+7-999-123-45-69"],42, true) -> [] number_check(vec!["8-999-123-12-12","8-999-123-12-13","8-999-123-12-14"], 1212, true) -> ["8-999-123-12-12"]; number_check(vec!["+112345522121","123-455-221-21","+1\345\52\21\21"], 221, false) -> ["+112345522121","123-455-221-21","+1\345\52\21\21"]; number_check(vec!["8-999-123-45-67","8-999-123-45-68","8-999-123-45-69"],123, false) -> ["8-999-123-45-67","8-999-123-45-68","8-999-123-45-69"] ```
